intro: Bumelia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian bumelia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland and montane regions. Bumelia amazonica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
